p: To determine the Minimum bactericidal Concentration (MBC), 10 µL of aliquot broth were taken from each well, and plated in Mueller–Hinton agar for 24 h at 37 °C for quality control strains, and 27 °C for plant bacteria. The MBC represents the concentration required to kill 99.9% or more of the initial inoculum [ 18]. The assays were performed in triplicate.
